column4: Now it says something about could not run Glib test program. heres the pastebin   http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/32256/
Been on linux 4 days and im still getting stuck on what i imagine should be simple
do i need to install or re install something called glib...whatever that is
are you using Pan for NZB files, or just regular news reading
this is the only version that runs nzb
will sudo apt-get build-dep pan get me the beta?
check this out when you get a chance, this is what i use for nzb and i love it --- http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=169749
i already installed checkinstall but i got another error...see pastebin?
did you see that Glib error at the bottom>
sizzam..no havent heard of it...only 4th day with this os
I used to use klibido for NZB.  its a KDE app in the repos
now I use hella, its all terminal based.  its a daemon thats always running.  as soon as you drop an NZB into a specified folder it picks it up and goes to work
